summary: A Bureau of Prisons memorandum detailing a reported suicide attempt by Jeffrey Epstein in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on July 23, 2019. The report includes conflicting accounts from Epstein and his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, regarding the incident, and notes Epstein's subsequent placement on suicide watch.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who reportedly attempted suicide in his cell. He was found on the floor with a red neck, placed on suicide watch, and later alleged his cellmate tried to kill him.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who reported finding Epstein with a string around his neck. He gave conflicting statements about the incident and was questioned by staff.

persons.name: Officer
persons.context: Staff member who observed Epstein after the incident and reported that Epstein was alert and made allegations against his cellmate.

persons.name: Dr.
persons.context: Medical staff notified and briefed about the incident. Determined no further medical attention was needed initially.

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: Medical staff who later examined and treated Epstein for injuries including a circular line of erythema on his neck.

connections.description: Shared a prison cell. Epstein alleged Tartaglione attempted to kill him and had been harassing him, while Tartaglione reported finding Epstein with a string around his neck.

events.title: Reported Suicide Attempt by Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell lying on the floor with a red neck, breathing heavily and snoring. He was placed on a stretcher, taken to the HA-Unit, dressed in a suicide smock, and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein's Allegation Against Cellmate
events.description: After the incident, Epstein told staff that his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, had attempted to kill him and had been harassing him, and that he had informed his attorney of this matter.

events.title: Tartaglione's Account of Incident
events.description: Nicholas Tartaglione stated he was asleep when he felt something hit his legs, turned on the light, and saw Epstein with a string around his neck. He then called the guards.

events.title: Epstein's Legal Visit
events.description: Epstein stated he came back from a legal visit at approximately 8:00 p.m. on July 22, and staff handed him a copy of the Daily News, which he gave to Tartaglione.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 a.m., with a red neck, breathing heavily and snoring, in what was reported as a suicide attempt.
Epstein later alleged that his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, had attempted to kill him and had been harassing him, and claimed he had informed his attorney of this.
Nicholas Tartaglione gave a conflicting account, stating he found Epstein with a string around his neck and called the guards.
Epstein was placed on suicide watch, exhibited unpredictable behavior, and was later treated for a circular line of erythema (redness) at the base of his neck.
The report notes a lack of available medical staff after 10:00 p.m., so a full medical assessment was not conducted immediately at the time of the incident.
